title: Add Sides type
description:
Add the famous `(left: ..., right: ..., top: ..., bottom: ...)` as a built-in type in elembic, say `e.types.sides(T)`.

It should:
- Cast from dictionary or T.
- Dictionary cast is checked: must contain left/right/top/bottom, or x/y/rest, all of type T.
- Casting from T means all sides have the same value.

title: Refactor `ssh.rs` to reduce massive methods
description: Currently, the logic for `ServerHandler::exec_request`, `ServerHandler::tcpip_forward`, and `ServerHandler::channel_open_direct_tcpip` is big, unwieldy, and deeply nested, and they'd certainly benefit from some refactoring that breaks them down into smaller pieces, or even separation of concerns (eg. separate parsing and interpreting in `exec_request`).

title: [BUG] is your tools support ipv6 address
description:
## Bug Description
I take my time to inspect your code source, it seems to me that your tools' fastapi guards don't support IPv6 address, Today with the shortage of IPv4 addresses almost everyone uses IPv6

## Steps To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Configure FastAPI Guard with '...'
2. Make request to endpoint '....'
3. See error

## Expected Behavior
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

## Actual Behavior
What actually happened, including error messages, stack traces, or logs.

## Environment
- FastAPI Guard version: [e.g. 2.1.2]
- Python version: [e.g. 3.11.10]
- FastAPI version: [e.g. 0.115.0]
- OS: [e.g. Ubuntu 22.04, Windows 11, MacOS 15.4]
- Other relevant dependencies:

## Configuration
```python
# Include your FastAPI Guard configuration here
from fastapi import FastAPI
from guard.middleware import SecurityMiddleware
from guard.models import SecurityConfig

app = FastAPI()

# Your configuration
security_config = SecurityConfig(
    # Include your config here
)

app.add_middleware(SecurityMiddleware, config=security_config)
```

## Additional Context
Add any other context about the problem here. For example:
- Is this happening in production or development?
- Does it happen consistently or intermittently?
- Have you tried any workarounds?

title: Centauri carbon selection, removes uv related sensors
description:
### Checklist

- [x] I have filled out the template to the best of my ability.
- [x] This only contains 1 feature request (if you have multiple feature requests, open one feature request for each feature request).
- [x] This issue is not a duplicate feature request of [previous feature requests](https://github.com/ludeeus/elegoo_printer/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Feature+Request%22+).

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

When adding a new printer and we select the Centauri carbon, it creates the device and sensors but then having to disable them as they are not relevant / needed. 


### Describe the solution you'd like

We we select the Centauri carbon in the config flow can that remove any sensors that are related to resin printers. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We we select the Centauri carbon in the config flow can that set to disabled any sensors that are related to resin printers. 

### Additional context

Sensors not needed with Centauri 
Release film
Release film max
UV LED temp
UV LED temp max
comments: Great idea!
Also "Box target temp" - this printer does not support setting target temp for chamber.

Perhaps we could replace it with just the sensors for the bed temp temperature sensors and print head sensors.

How can I send a request to the printer to determine what sensors are actually available?

then edit debug.py, put in your ip_address, make sure centuari_carbon is false, then run `make debug`

title: Add long versions of structures
description:
Currently wide, eg:

``` r
library(strayr)
#> Loading required package: absmapsdata
anzsco
#> # A tibble: 1,180 x 11
#>    anzsco_major_code anzsco_major anzsco_submajor_… anzsco_submajor             
#>    <chr>             <chr>        <chr>             <chr>                       
#>  1 1                 Managers     10                Managers, nfd               
#>  2 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#>  3 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#>  4 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#>  5 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#>  6 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#>  7 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#>  8 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#>  9 1                 Managers     11                Chief Executives, General M…
#> 10 1                 Managers     12                Farmers and Farm Managers   
#> # … with 1,170 more rows, and 7 more variables: anzsco_minor_code <chr>,
#> #   anzsco_minor <chr>, anzsco_unit_code <chr>, anzsco_unit <chr>,
#> #   anzsco_occupation_code <chr>, anzsco_occupation <chr>, skill_level <chr>
```

But there are use-cases for having this structure in long-form, as suggested by @daviddiviny .
comments:
Keen to make a PR for this.

I would assume we would want to maintain the current naming convention `anzsco2019` for the wide formats and add the `_long` for the long formats, for example: `anzsco2019_long`?

It would cause potential major disruption for any users, but I do like the explicit naming conventions.

Great, @johann-wagner! 

If we leave the existing wide objects unchanged and with the same names, why would it disrupt any users? We'd just be adding an alternative format, right?

Yes agreed! 

Sorry for ambiguity in the comment! 😬

I was suggesting if we were to change the existing name from `anzsco2019` to `anzsco2019_wide` then we would end up with problems, as well as including `_long` for the new alternative format. This approach allows the naming conventions to be more explicit in formats, but obviously causes issues for reproducibility.

But yes I agree with you, just adding `_long` to the new alternative formats and not adjusting any current names is the appropriate approach.
Great! Yeah I reckon leaving current objects unchanged and adding `_long` versions would be great

thanks @johann-wagner!

could also/alternatively consider exporting a function e.g. pivot_structure_wider(osca2024) that would return a wide format?

might make things simpler/avoid duplicating objects (though not a huge concern)

I like it! I was thinking that would be a cleaner approach.

I assume you're referring to creating a function to pivot from wide to long. ☺️

Especially given there's other structures that might be useful to have in long format.

Even the code for the creation of all the different anzsco/osca versions are quite similar that parts could be extracted as a function. Although might complicate things further. Separate (potential) issue anyway.
Ha, yes from wide to long. And sounds good

title: Build Modern Gaming Landing Page for noob.gg LFG Platform
description:
## 🎯 Goal Create a visually appealing, modern landing page for noob.gg that effectively showcases the LFG (Looking For Group) gaming platform and drives user registrations. The current landing page needs a complete redesign to match the platform's gaming aesthetic and business objectives. ## 📋 Current State & Problem Based on the PRD analysis, the current landing page is described as "very ugly" and doesn't effectively: - Showcase the six supported games (Fortnite, CS2, League of Legends, Valorant, Rainbow Six Siege, Minecraft) - Communicate the platform's value proposition clearly - Drive the target of 2,000 user registrations within three months - Provide an engaging first impression for the gaming community ## 🎮 Platform Overview (from PRD) **noob.gg** is an LFG Lobby system that empowers gamers to: - Effortlessly create, join, and manage game sessions - Connect with teammates through matchmaking and in-lobby chat - Build social connections and gaming communities - Access everything through an intuitive web-based interface ## 🛠️ Implementation Plan ### 1. Hero Section **Design a compelling above-the-fold experience:** ```typescript // Hero Component Structure const HeroSection = () => { return (
{/* Animated background with gaming elements */}
{/* Main content */}
{/* Logo */}

noob.gg

Find Your Gaming Squad

Join thousands of gamers finding teammates for epic sessions. Create lobbies, chat with players, and build your gaming community.

Social Proof & Stats **Build trust with community metrics:** ```typescript const StatsSection = () => { const stats = [ { number: "10K+", label: "Active Gamers" }, { number: "50K+", label: "Lobbies Created" }, { number: "500K+", label: "Matches Played" }, { number: "24/7", label: "Community Support" } ]; return (

[ ] Plan responsive breakpoints - [ ] Design component architecture ### Phase 2: Core Components (5 days) - [ ] Build Hero section with animations - [ ] Create Games showcase grid - [ ] Implement Features section - [ ] Build How It Works timeline - [ ] Add Stats/Social proof section - [ ] Create final CTA section ### Phase 3: Interactivity & Polish (3 days) - [ ] Add smooth scroll animations - [ ] Implement hover effects and micro-interactions - Touch-friendly interactions - Fast loading on all devices ## 🎯 Success Metrics & Goals ### Primary KPIs - **Registration Conversion**: Target 5-8% of landing page visitors - **Bounce Rate**: Keep below 40% - **Time on Page**: Target 2+ minutes average - **CTA Click Rate**: Target 15%+ on primary buttons ### Business Alignment - Support the goal of 2,000 user registrations in 3 months - Clearly communicate value proposition - Showcase all six supported games - Build trust and credibility ## 🔧 Technical Considerations ### Performance - Optimize images with Next.js Image component - Lazy load below-the-fold content - Minimize bundle size with code splitting - Target Lighthouse score of 90+ ### SEO & Accessibility - Semantic HTML structure - Proper heading hierarchy - Alt text for all images - Keyboard navigation support - Screen reader compatibility ### Integration Points - Connect with existing Auth.js authentication - Link to dashboard/lobby creation flows - Integrate with analytics tracking - Support for next-intl internationalization ## ✅ Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Landing page loads in under 3 seconds - [ ] All six games are prominently featured - [ ] Clear value proposition is communicated - [ ] Registration flow is accessible from multiple CTAs - [ ] Responsive design works on all screen sizes - [ ] Animations enhance UX without being distracting - [ ] SEO meta tags are properly configured - [ ] Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA) are met - [ ] Cross-browser compatibility (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) - [ ] Integration with existing authentication system ## 📚 Resources - [Gaming UI Design Inspiration](https://dribbble.com/tags/gaming_ui) - [Next.js Image Optimization](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/images) - [Framer Motion Animations](https://www.framer.com/motion/) - [Tailwind CSS Gaming Themes](https://tailwindui.com/) - [Web Accessibility Guidelines](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/) - [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/vitals/) ## 🏷️ Labels `enhancement`, `ui/ux`, `landing-page`, `design`, `frontend`, `high-priority`, `junior-friendly` --- **Priority**: High **Estimated Effort**: 2-3 sprints **Dependencies**: Issue #48 (Poppins Font Integration) **Assignee**: Frontend team + Designer

title: Erstelle ein docker-compose.dev.yml, indem die daten der datenbank beim neuen build gelöscht werden.
description:
In diesem docker-compose, sollte die datenbank nicht mit einem volumn erstellt werden. 
Die Daten sollen stattdessen im container gespeichert werden. 
Dadurch hat man nach jedem neuen build wieder eine frische Datenbank mit immer den selben daten.

title: Enhance SEO and Metadata Strategy
description:
# Issue: Enhance SEO and Metadata Strategy

## Description

The current website lacks a comprehensive SEO strategy, with inconsistent metadata, missing structured data, and poor semantic HTML structure. This negatively impacts our search engine rankings and discoverability. We need to implement a robust SEO strategy to improve visibility and organic traffic.

## Current Implementation Issues

- Inconsistent or missing page titles and meta descriptions
- No structured data (Schema.org) for key content types
- Poor semantic HTML structure affecting content hierarchy
- Missing OpenGraph and Twitter card metadata
- No XML sitemap or robots.txt configuration
- Inadequate handling of canonical URLs
- No implementation of breadcrumbs for improved navigation
- Missing alt text for many images
- No strategy for handling redirects and 404 errors
- Poor URL structure for content discoverability

## Proposed Solution

Implement a comprehensive SEO enhancement that:
- Standardizes metadata across all pages
- Adds appropriate structured data for rich snippets
- Improves semantic HTML structure
- Implements complete social sharing metadata
- Creates proper XML sitemap and robots.txt
- Handles canonical URLs correctly
- Implements breadcrumb navigation
- Ensures all images have descriptive alt text
- Creates a strategy for handling redirects and 404s
- Optimizes URL structure for discoverability

## Implementation Requirements

- Audit current SEO status and identify improvement opportunities
- Create metadata templates for different page types
- Implement structured data based on page content
- Refactor HTML to use appropriate semantic elements
- Add OpenGraph and Twitter card metadata
- Generate and maintain XML sitemap
- Create proper robots.txt with sitemap reference
- Add canonical URL handling
- Implement breadcrumb navigation
- Create a redirect strategy for changed URLs
- Optimize URL structure for content discoverability

## Acceptance Criteria

- All pages have appropriate title, description, and keyword metadata
- Structured data validates with no errors in Google's Structured Data Testing Tool
- HTML structure uses semantic elements appropriately
- Social sharing shows correct previews on major platforms
- XML sitemap includes all indexable pages and is automatically updated
- robots.txt correctly guides search engine crawlers
- Canonical URLs prevent duplicate content issues
- Breadcrumb navigation is available for all content pages
- All images have descriptive alt text
- 404 pages are handled gracefully with helpful navigation
- URL structure follows SEO best practices

## Additional Notes

This enhancement should be done in collaboration with marketing to ensure SEO strategy aligns with overall marketing goals. Consider implementing tools for ongoing SEO monitoring and improvement.

description: Currently if a user is on repo list and navigates to page 2, then clicks to manage repo labels and then goes back to repo list - it will navigate to page 1. It should remember which page was previously active - in this case it should navigate to page 2

title: Endpoint for creating reservations
description:
# 📘 Implement POST /api/bookings Endpoint for Creating Reservations

## 🎯 Objective
Create a secure `POST /api/bookings` endpoint that allows authenticated users to create reservations for properties in StellarRent. The endpoint should verify availability, create an escrow using Trustless Work, and store the reservation in Supabase, following best practices for data validation, blockchain integration, and error handling.

## 🛠️ Technical Stack
- **Backend**: Node.js & Express.js
- **Database**: Supabase
- **Blockchain**: Stellar (Soroban for availability verification, Trustless Work for escrow)
- **Authentication**: JWT
- **Validation**: Zod
- **Types**: TypeScript
- **Testing**: Jest
- **Code Quality**: ESLint/Prettier

## 🔍 Technical Tasks

### Database Schema
- [ ] Create `bookings` table in Supabase:
```sql
create table public.bookings (
  id uuid default uuid_generate_v4() primary key,
  property_id uuid references public.properties(id) not null,
  user_id uuid references public.users(id) not null,
  dates jsonb not null, -- { from: "YYYY-MM-DD", to: "YYYY-MM-DD" }
  guests integer not null,
  total decimal(10,2) not null, -- Total cost (nights × price + deposit)
  deposit decimal(10,2) not null, -- Security deposit
  escrow_address text not null, -- Stellar address for escrow
  status text not null default 'pending', -- pending, confirmed, cancelled, completed
  created_at timestamp with time zone default timezone('utc'::text, now()) not null,
  updated_at timestamp with time zone default timezone('utc'::text, now()) not null,
  constraint status_values check (status in ('pending', 'confirmed', 'cancelled', 'completed')),
  constraint guests_check check (guests > 0),
  constraint total_check check (total > 0),
  constraint deposit_check check (deposit >= 0)
);
```

### Type definitions
Create apps/backend/src/types/booking.types.ts:
```sql
import { z } from 'zod';

export interface Booking {
  id: string; // UUID generated by Supabase
  propertyId: string; // References properties.id
  userId: string; // References users.id
  dates: { from: Date; to: Date }; // Reservation dates
  guests: number; // Number of guests
  total: number; // Total cost in USDC (nights × price + deposit)
  deposit: number; // Security deposit in USDC
  escrowAddress: string; // Stellar escrow address from Trustless Work
  status: 'pending' | 'confirmed' | 'cancelled' | 'completed'; // Booking status
  createdAt: Date; // Automatically managed by Supabase
  updatedAt: Date; // Automatically managed by Supabase
}

export const createBookingSchema = z.object({
  propertyId: z.string().uuid('Invalid property ID'),
  userId: z.string().uuid('Invalid user ID'),
  dates: z.object({
    from: z.date().refine((date) => date >= new Date(), { message: 'The start date must be in the future' }),
    to: z.date()
  }).refine((data) => data.to > data.from, { message: 'The end date must be later than the start date' }),
  guests: z.number().int('Guests must be an integer').positive('Guests must be positive'),
  total: z.number().positive('Total cost must be positive'),
  deposit: z.number().nonnegative('Deposit must be non-negative')
});

export type CreateBookingInput = z.infer<typeof createBookingSchema>;
```
### Service Layer
- [ ] Create `apps/backend/src/services/booking.service.ts`:
  - Implement `createBooking` function to validate availability using Soroban `BookingContract`, create escrow with Trustless Work, and store the reservation in Supabase.
  - Add error handling for blockchain and database operations.
  - Add TypeScript types for all operations.

### Controller Layer
- [ ] Create `apps/backend/src/controllers/booking.controller.ts`:
  - Implement input validation with Zod.
  - Handle service responses.
  - Format error messages.
  - Add proper status codes (201 for success, 400 for validation errors, etc.).

### Routes
- [ ] Create `apps/backend/src/routes/booking.routes.ts`:
  - Set up the booking route for `POST /api/bookings`.
  - Apply authentication middleware (JWT).
  - Apply validation middleware (Zod).
  - Configure error handling.

### Testing
- [ ] Create `apps/backend/src/tests/booking.test.ts`:
  - Test successful booking creation.
  - Test authentication failures (missing/invalid token).
  - Test validation errors (invalid dates, guests, etc.).
  - Test availability conflicts (using Soroban).
  - Test escrow creation failures (using Trustless Work).
  - Test database errors.

## ✅ Acceptance Criteria

### Authentication
- [ ] Endpoint requires a valid JWT token.
- [ ] Token must be provided in `Authorization: Bearer <token>` format.
- [ ] Invalid or missing tokens return 401 with a clear error message.

### Input Validation
- [ ] All required fields (`propertyId`, `userId`, `dates`, `guests`, `total`, `deposit`) are present and valid.
- [ ] `propertyId` and `userId` must be valid UUIDs.
- [ ] `dates.from` must be in the future.
- [ ] `dates.to` must be later than `dates.from`.
- [ ] `guests` must be a positive integer.
- [ ] `total` must be positive.
- [ ] `deposit` must be non-negative.
- [ ] Invalid inputs return 400 with validation details.

### Availability Check
- [ ] Use Soroban `BookingContract` to verify that the requested dates are available for the property.
- [ ] If dates are unavailable, return 409 with a message: "Property is not available for the selected dates".

### Escrow Creation
- [ ] Use Trustless Work to create an escrow for the payment and deposit.
- [ ] Store the escrow address in the booking record.
- [ ] If escrow creation fails, return 500 with a message: "Failed to create escrow".

### Response Format
#### Success (201)
- A JSON object with a `booking` field containing `bookingId` (e.g., "book-789"), `escrowAddress` (e.g., "GABC..."), and `status` (e.g., "pending").

#### Validation Error (400)
- A JSON object with an `error` field ("Validation error") and a `details` array containing validation errors (e.g., field "dates.from" with message "The start date must be in the future").

#### Conflict Error (409)
- A JSON object with an `error` field ("Property is not available for the selected dates").

### Error Handling
- [ ] Authentication errors: 401.
- [ ] Validation errors: 400.
- [ ] Availability conflicts: 409.
- [ ] Escrow or blockchain errors: 500.
- [ ] Database errors: 500.
- [ ] All errors include descriptive messages.

## 📚 References
- [Supabase Documentation](https://supabase.com/docs)
- [Stellar Soroban Documentation](https://soroban.stellar.org/docs)
- [Trustless Work Documentation](https://trustless.work/docs)
- [Express.js Routing](https://expressjs.com/en/guide/routing.html)
- [JWT Authentication](https://jwt.io/introduction)
- [Zod Schema Validation](https://zod.dev/)

## 🔄 Dependencies
- Authentication middleware implemented.
- Supabase connection configured.
- Error handling middleware implemented.
- Soroban `BookingContract` deployed and accessible.
- Trustless Work integration configured.
- Properties and users tables in Supabase.

## 🔒 Security Considerations
- Validate and sanitize all inputs.
- Ensure proper CORS configuration.
- Rate limit the endpoint.
- Log all booking attempts.
- Validate total and deposit amounts.
- Secure blockchain interactions with Trustless Work.
- Implement retry logic for escrow creation.

title: Use mkdocs-material tabs for different cases of the same thing in the docs
description:
**Is your documentation request related to a problem? Please describe.**  
Some parts of the documentation present multiple ways to perform the same task, leading to duplication. For example, the installation guide lists `pipx` and `uv` as separate sections, which makes the documentation longer and more repetitive than necessary.  

**Describe what documentation needs to be added or improved**  
The documentation should use [mkdocs-material tabs](https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/reference/content-tabs/) to present alternative methods concisely. This will make the docs easier to read while still providing multiple options.  

**Affected documentation pages or sections**  
- Installation guide  
- Any other sections where multiple ways to perform a task are documented separately  

**Proposed changes (if applicable)**  
Replace separate code blocks for different installation methods with mkdocs-material tabs, like this:  

```markdown
=== "pipx"
    ```bash
    pipx install brag-ai
    ```
=== "uv"
    ```bash
    uv tool install brag-ai
    ```
```

This approach can be applied to other parts of the documentation where similar duplication exists.

**Additional information or examples**

- Reference: [mkdocs-material tabs documentation](https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/reference/content-tabs/)
- This change will make the documentation cleaner and easier to navigate.
comments: @sourcery-ai plan

## Objectives
- Implement mkdocs-material tabs in the installation guide to consolidate multiple installation methods
- Identify and update other documentation sections with duplicative content that could benefit from tabs
- Ensure proper configuration of mkdocs-material tabs in `mkdocs.yml`
- Follow the mkdocs-material tab syntax format for consistent implementation
- Maintain readability and user experience while reducing documentation length
- Verify that all tab implementations work correctly across the documentation



## File changes
`mkdocs.yml`

- Verify that the necessary markdown extensions for content tabs are already configured
- Confirm that `pymdownx.superfences` and `pymdownx.tabbed` with `alternate_style: true` are already present

`docs/installation.md`

- Replace separate installation method sections with mkdocs-material tabs
- Create tabs for `uv`, `pipx`, and `pip` installation methods
- Use the tab format `=== "tab_name"` followed by content for each installation method
- Maintain all existing installation instructions but organize them under tabs
- Keep the Requirements and Environment Setup sections unchanged

`docs/index.md`

- Update the Getting Started section to use tabs for different installation methods
- Replace the current code block with tabbed content for `uv`, `pipx`, and `pip`
- Maintain the same installation commands but organize them under tabs

`docs/usage.md`

- Convert the AI model examples section to use tabs
- Create tabs for OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google models
- Maintain all existing example commands but organize them under tabs

`docs/configuration.md`

- Convert the Example Configurations section to use tabs
- Create tabs for different configuration examples
- Maintain all existing example commands but organize them under tabs

## Verify changes
- `bash scripts/docs-build.sh`
- `bash scripts/docs-serve.sh &`

---

This plan was automatically generated.
Please review the plan carefully and make any necessary adjustments.

title: 【下个版本新闻区】version 0.2.0 更新内容一览与讨论
description:
## 总览
为了让角色的情绪更加生动，给角色的故事提供一个记忆的方式，可以作为服务器部署并且给多用户提供服务的方式，决定增加一下功能：

1. 将12类情感分类模型扩展，新增18类情感分类模型 √ **已完成**
2. 为网页添加读档，存档功能 √ **已完成**
3.  支持用户注册和登录，根据用户提供对话  X **暂不做**

## 分工
1. 目前18类情感分类模型 **已完成** √

2. 网页的读档，存档功能前端UI部分已经更新完毕，由**钦灵**负责开发，关于文件的读写和对网页的动态扩展，可以由nodejs的api完成，由**有梦当燃**负责开发  **已完成** √
涉及文件主要包括：
```
frontend\public\
frontend\server.js
```
3. 用户的注册和登录已经由**远足**给了个大概的开发框架，目前规划是给“处女”客户端一个默认的管理员权限，同时他也不需要注册登录，但当其他客户端需要登录的时候，就需要使用账户和密码。这部分代码将由**钦灵**更改并且实装，将采用SQLITE数据库存储  
涉及文件主要包括：
```
backend\
frontend\
```
---
如果你发现制作的部分和本项目主线冲突，亦或有更多细节需要补充，和我联系❤
comments:
我认为，项目按多用户服务器部署模式开发。

其中为服务器-多用户部署模式提供详尽的教程，但不做任何易用性优化。

为个人本地部署模式提供易用性优化：该实质是第一次启动自动注册，后续启动时以本地用户账号登录。同时在Readme中提供本地账户默认的用户名和密码

### 目前进度
存档和多情绪功能包括表情适配和气泡音效已制作完毕，最后一个功能“多用户”，考虑到目前的开发方向，如果不做创新而是做太多关于技术性的东西会导致很多不必要的麻烦，决定多用户功能暂时缓缓。目前多用户的数据库已经设计完毕，虽然未完整实现功能，不过暂存为后续发展埋下伏笔  (∠・ω< )⌒★

# 0.2.0-正式版



## 🎉 新增（Add）

#### 功能性更新：

- 增加了情感识别的种类，从原有的12类情感拓展至18类情感
- 绘制了18类情感对应的差分差分表情图像
- 增加了对话存档功能，支持历史对话记录的导入和加载
- 增加了跨对话永久记忆功能，基于向量检索技术构建(此功能可关闭)
- 现在AI可以读取当前本地的系统时间
- 添加了对ollama本地部署模型的支持
- 打包了轻量化浏览器并内置于项目中，现在项目不再依赖外部浏览器
- 添加了开发者专用DEBUG模式

#### 界面与样式更新：

- 前端菜单、界面样式大幅美化，增加动态元素与动效
- 增加存档界面美术资源与CSS样式美化
- 重写了后端日志系统，支持了彩色和动态日志，添加启动界面与 ASCII 标题

#### 架构与系统更新：

- 添加了 Docker 部署支持，包含 Go 与 Python 模块的 Dockerfile 及 Compose 配置。
- 移除对 Node.js 的依赖，精简后端依赖项
- 添加服务器部署模式配置，支持多用户多注册与管理等功能，支持 HTTP 接口与 WebSocket 通信
- 添加配置化系统支持，数据库连接、模型路径等均可通过 config 文件管理。
- 后端系统新增基于 Go 的完整实现



## 🔧修复（Fix）

- 修复菜单显示后无法继续输入消息的bug
- 修复切换菜单后可能出现闪屏与元素显示错位的问题
- 修复前端动作不显示的问题
- 修复存档状态不一致、日志系统非单例、数据库未初始化等严重错误
- 修复日志系统将对话 log 与程序 log 混杂的问题，完成重构
- 修复自动安装 VITS 语音模型脚本中 URL 与解压格式配置错误
- 修复使用中文路径导致启动脚本报错的问题
- 修复Enter过快时造成的UI消息越界问题
- 修复多个启动参数混用与日志等级判断逻辑错误
- 修复情绪与动作表达组件布局不统一问题



## 📌修改与重构（Modified / Refactor）

- 重构了Python后端，拆分原有 Python 模块，实现了后端模块化结构
- 重构了前端，增强了兼容性与可维护性
- 重构日志系统，调整为单例模式，提升稳定性与线程安全性。
- 整理 Go 与 Python 后端模块结构，统一接口风格。
- 优化了 CSS 样式结构

comments: May I handle this issue?

Hi! I'd love to take on the real-time updates feature using WebSockets in NestJS. I’ll set up a robust WebSocket gateway to push live inventory and dashboard updates, ensuring scalability and stable connection handling. Using @WebSocketGateway with proper events and broadcasting strategies, I’ll ensure clients receive real-time stock changes. I can complete this in 2-3 days with clean, maintainable code and necessary documentation. Looking forward to contributing to this improvement!

Hi @Xaxxoo Thanks for assigning tasks to me.
Is it okay to get started this task on Monday?

title: [Feature Request] Add keybinding to switch between active layout
description:
**Describe the feature you'd like**
Thank you for the great extension! It would be nice to have a keybinding to select the active layout by cycling through all available layouts. This can currently only be done by clicking on the tray icon and selecting the layout that should be active.
comments: Hey! Thank you for your suggestion! With this extension my focus is on extending default behavior of GNOME Shell or implement loved features from other OSs. Your idea would be something new, what would be a good default keybinding to select the active layout in your opinion? Of course allowing to customize it from the preferences.
Would SUPER + CTRL + Arrow Left / Arrow Right be a good option?

I suggested this in #36 as well 😉.

I think it's a great idea to accompany the other keyboard shortcuts which are working great.

I'm not sure what shortcut but something without conflicts would be good. Super + n, super + b?

Away from the computer so not sure if that conflicts.

Edit: if Super + alt is used to span tiles then super + ctrl for this makes sense!

I would also like this feature. 

Perhaps in addition to a keyboard shortcut, would it also be possible to use the scrollwheel while holding a window + CTRL ? So you effectively scroll through the configured layouts.

Thank you guys for your feedback! A quick update for you. I'm going to publish a new update this week and then I'm going to start to work on this :partying_face:

Just a little mockup for you, feel free to share your thoughts! This feature will behave similarly to ALT+TAB: when the keyboard shortcut is pressed, the layouts are shown and you can cycle through them to select the layout:
![Group 6](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/assets/14203981/44055b6f-64ee-41d6-a7b0-a94512d9c4b0)

I'm still not sure which default shortcut to choose, but it will be customizable.
This is exactly how I wanted it to be!
Looks good 😎

I mentioned in #117 that I'd elaborate on one of my frequent workflows that this would greatly facilitate:

My coding layout frequently looks something like this:
```
-------------
|  |   |----|
-------------
```
Two full-height windows then two half-height windows stacked on top of one another.
The leftmost window is usually a browser window, the middle my code editor, and the right two are different terminal windows.

Another common layout I use (I'm on an ultrawide monitor) is this:
```
-------------
|  |     |  |
-------------
```
Three full-height windows with the center one being larger. I generally have the left two windows the same as above (browser, code editor). Then, the rightmost window is frequently some sort of documentation.

I frequently switch between these two layouts while working.

I think this feature would be a great addition as it would eliminate most mouse usage.

I like the mock-up.

I suggest `<Super><tab>` as the hot key.
I would love this even more now that auto-tiling is a thing! Would complement it nicely imo.
@domferr progress update? it has been ~6 months

Hi @skewty, no progress unfortunately. Believe it or not, but I'm the only developer of Tiling Shell and in the last months I had to make a choice and I had to prioritize other features, I'm sorry. There have been contributions from other developers as well but on other topics.

This feature is definitely going to be implemented! I believe this is a must have and I hope to prioritize this over other features in the coming releases 🌟 
Meanwhile, if anyone wants to give it a try, even just contributing to a portion of this feature, the following is a hopefully exhaustive list of things to be done. Feel free to reach me out here or with a new issue if you wanna contribute! Your help would mean A LOT 💟 
- Create a widget implementing the mockup above. The sizes could be the same as the ones in ALT+TAB.
- Listen to a shortcut defined in the settings to show and switch layouts, as in the mockup above. To be more clear, this has to work exactly how ALT+TAB works 😎 so we can copy the same strategies they use
- Add a new entry in the preferences' shortcuts to allow users set and unset the shortcut. If the shortcut is set, this feature can be considered enabled, so we don't need to add an enable-disable entry in the preferences too
- The layout has NOT to be changed globally. The layout has to be changed on the current monitor and current workspace. To switch layout we can follow how I developed the layout switcher behind the indicator icon menu
- The layout has to be changed when the shortcut is released. For example, if there are 4 layouts, the widget must show which one is the current layout and pressing the shortcut X times would move the selection X times. When moving the selection it is better to don't switch the layout yet, to save resources. The layout can be finally switched when the user has made its decision (e.g. the shortcut is released). To make it more clear, this is exactly the same behaviour we have when pressing ALT+TAB and switching windows
- Like it works when pressing ALT+TAB, if the user is on the last layout on the right, pressing the shortcut will move the selection to the first layout from the left

_Does it mean that without any contribution this feature will never be implemented?_ No. At some point I will develop it. But any contribution would speed up the process 🥇
Hey @domferr has there been any progress on this feature? If not I'd love to find some time to start developing this

Hey @joj0s no progress at all unfortunately! I would love if you could contribute with this feature or just a portion of it! Let me know how I can support you, thank you so much! Feel free to reach me out here whenever you want

title: ✨ Control parsing and convertion of phase gates
description:
**Copied from [munich-quantum-toolkit/core #910](https://github.com/munich-quantum-toolkit/core/issues/910)**

### What's the problem this feature will solve?

Currently phase gates and (multi-)controlled phase gates get converted to Z, S, and T gates based on the phase they introduce.
While these are common names, it makes handling general phase gates unnecessarily difficult, as one needs to make a case distinction every time.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be nice to have an optional flag for the import, or an optional pass that converts all phase-related gates into phase/cphase/mcphase gates.

title: refactor bartiq to use single symbol for expressing `pow` method
description:
**Copied from [PsiQ/bartiq #138](https://github.com/PsiQ/bartiq/issues/138)**

Currently in Bartiq we allow to express `pow` function as both `^` and `**`. 
This is problematic since:
- `^` in Python is a XOR operator, 
- an expression including one symbol could be later serialized and the symbol might turn into a different one, which could be confusing.

After [some discussion with @dexter2206](https://github.com/PsiQ/qref/pull/124#discussion_r1830899552), we think that using `**` would be better than `^`.

title: Middleware
description: A middleware system to add optional things such as cookies, compression, ...
comments:
There have been relevant discussions on this at [discord](https://discord.com/channels/1110653305253806132/1321093314296025170/1374815138539901040).

<details>
<summary>Relavant code</summary>

### globals.lua

```lua
local inspect = require("inspect").inspect

do
    if pcall(require, 'jit') then
        local x = require 'jit'
        print("Server uses:", _VERSION, x.version)
    else
        print("Server uses:", _VERSION)
    end
end


GET         = "GET"
POST        = "POST"
PUT         = "PUT"
PATCH       = "PATCH"
DELETE      = "DELETE"
OPTIONS     = "OPTIONS"
TRACE       = "TRACE"
STATIC_DIR  = "STATIC_DIR"
STATIC_FILE = "STATIC_FILE"


local routeTypeToAstraFunction = {
    GET         = Astra.get,
    POST        = Astra.post,
    PUT         = Astra.put,
    PATCH       = Astra.patch,
    DELETE      = Astra.delete,
    OPTIONS     = Astra.options,
    TRACE       = Astra.trace,
    STATIC_DIR  = Astra.static_dir,
    STATIC_FILE = Astra.static_file,
}


local httpRoutes = {
    GET     = "GET",
    POST    = "POST",
    PUT     = "PUT",
    PATCH   = "PATCH",
    DELETE  = "DELETE",
    OPTIONS = "OPTIONS",
    TRACE   = "TRACE",
}


local staticRoutes = {
    STATIC_DIR  = "STATIC_DIR",
    STATIC_FILE = "STATIC_FILE",
}

local function validateRouteParams(route, base_middleware)
    local route_type, path, callback_or_serve_path, config = route[1], route[2], route[3], route[4]

    assert(routeTypeToAstraFunction[route_type],
        "Unknown route type `" .. route_type .. "`: " .. inspect(route))
    assert(type(path) == "string",
        "Path must be a string, got `" .. type(path) .. "`: " .. inspect(route))
    assert((type(config) == "table") or (type(config) == "nil"),
        "Config must be a table, got `" .. type(config) .. "`: " .. inspect(route))
    if httpRoutes[route_type] then
        local callback = callback_or_serve_path
        assert(type(callback) == "function",
            "Callback must be a function, got `" .. type(callback) .. "`: " .. inspect(route))
        if base_middleware then
            callback_or_serve_path = base_middleware(callback_or_serve_path)
        end
    elseif staticRoutes[route_type] then
        local serve_path = callback_or_serve_path
        assert(type(serve_path) == "string",
            "Serve path must be a string, got `" .. type(serve_path) .. "`: " .. inspect(route))
    end

    return route_type, path, callback_or_serve_path, config
end

function Routes(routes)
    local base_middleware = routes.base_middleware
    for _, route in ipairs(routes) do
        local route_type, path, callback_or_serve_path, config = validateRouteParams(route, base_middleware)
        routeTypeToAstraFunction[route_type](Astra, path, callback_or_serve_path, config)
    end
end
```

### inspect.lua

```lua
local _tl_compat; if (tonumber((_VERSION or ''):match('[%d.]*$')) or 0) < 5.3 then local p, m = pcall(require, 'compat53.module'); if p then _tl_compat = m end end; local math = _tl_compat and _tl_compat.math or math; local string = _tl_compat and _tl_compat.string or string; local table = _tl_compat and _tl_compat.table or table
local inspect = {Options = {}, }
```

### main.lua

```lua
require "globals"
local inspect = require("inspect").inspect

---Multiple headers example
---@param request Request
---@param response Response
local function handleHeaders(request, response)
    response:set_header("Server", "Astra/0.19.1")
    response:set_header("Content-Type", "text/html")
    response:set_status_code(401)
    return json.encode { some = "json", actually = "html" }
end

local function logger(next_handler)
    return function(request, response, ctx)
        -- Entry part
        print("Logger enter")
        print("Request:", request:method(), request:uri(), inspect(request:queries()))
        ctx.logger = {}
        ctx.logger.hello = "hello from logger"
        local result = next_handler(request, response, ctx)
        -- Leave part
        print("got from root handler:", ctx.logger.bye)
        print("Logger leave")
        return result
    end
end

local function ctx(next_handler)
    return function(request, response)
        print("Ctx enter")
        local ctx = {}
        local result = next_handler(request, response, ctx)
        print("Ctx leave")
        return result
    end
end

---Handle test
---@param request Request
---@param response Response
local function handleTest(request, response, ctx)
    response:set_header("Content-Type", "text/html")
    print("hello from context:", ctx.logger.hello)
    ctx.logger.bye = "Bye from test"
    return json.encode { ["hi"] = "there" }
end

local function my_middleware(next_handler)
    return function(request, response, ctx)
        -- Pre-handler logic
        local result = next_handler(request, response, ctx)
        -- Post-handler logic
        return result
    end
end

local function auth(next_handler)
    return function(request, response, ctx)
        -- Pre-handler logic
        print("auth enter")
        local result = next_handler(request, response, ctx)
        -- Post-handler logic
        print("auth leave")
        return result
    end
end

local function rateLimit(next_handler)
    return function(request, response, ctx)
        -- Pre-handler logic
        print("Rate limit enter")
        local result = next_handler(request, response, ctx)
        -- Post-handler logic
        print("Rate limit leave")
        return result
    end
end


---Chains route middleware
local function chain(chain)
    return function(handler)
        assert(type(handler) == "function",
            "Handler must be a function, got " .. type(handler))
        assert(#chain >= 2, "Chain must have at least 2 middlewares")
        for i = #chain, 1, -1 do
            local middleware = chain[i]
            assert(type(middleware) == "function",
                "Middleware must be a function, got " .. type(middleware))
            handler = middleware(handler)
        end
        return handler
    end
end

local function justHi(req, res)
    return "hi"
end

Routes {
    base_middleware = chain { ctx, logger },
    { GET, "/test",    chain { rateLimit, auth } (handleTest) },
    { GET, "/headers", rateLimit(handleHeaders) },
    { GET, "/",        justHi },
}


Astra:run()
```

</details>

It is quite interesting with an architecture similar to: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9b58a783-7730-4847-a5ba-20818d052248)

> [!NOTE]
> The source code and discussion was provided by `@ryzh.` on discord.

Link to full `inspect.lua` https://github.com/kikito/inspect.lua/blob/master/inspect.lua

And some explanatory diagram:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/de65c11a-c4c7-453e-a80c-87908bcdc272)

title: Support Editing and Deleting Registered Data Sources
description:
Implement functionality to allow users to **edit** and **delete** registered data sources, improving management and cleanup of data source configurations.

**Current Behavior:**

* Once a data source is registered, it cannot be modified or removed through the UI or API.

**Expected Features:**

1. **Edit Data Source:**

   * Update properties such as name, connection details, or credentials.
   * Validate inputs to prevent misconfiguration.

2. **Delete Data Source:**

   * Remove unused or obsolete data sources.
   * Provide confirmation prompts to avoid accidental deletion.
   * Consider handling or warning about dependent applications or data.

**Tasks:**

* Add UI controls for editing and deleting data sources.
* Create corresponding backend API endpoints (`PUT /data-sources/{id}`, `DELETE /data-sources/{id}`).
* Implement validation and permission checks.
* Handle potential cascading impacts or restrict deletion if dependencies exist.

**Benefits:**

* Enhances flexibility in managing data sources.
* Keeps configuration clean and up-to-date.
* Supports better system hygiene and administration.

title: Better documentation needed
description:
We need to add comprehensive documentation to our GitHub repository to help new contributors understand the project, its structure, and how to contribute. Proper documentation will also assist users in understanding how to use the project effectively.

**Documentation should include:**

1. **Overview**
   - Brief description of the project.
   - Key features and functionalities.

2. **Installation**
   - Prerequisites.
   - Step-by-step installation guide.
   - Configuration instructions.

3. **Usage**
   - How to run the project.
   - Basic usage examples.
   - Explanation of main components.
   
4. **Contributing**
   - Contribution guidelines.
   - How to report issues.
   - How to submit pull requests.
   - Code of conduct.

5. **FAQs**
   - Common issues and troubleshooting.
   - Frequently asked questions.

6. **License**
   - Licensing information.

**Additional Notes:**

- Use Markdown for documentation.
- Include images/screenshots where applicable.
- Ensure the documentation is easy to navigate and well-organized.

**Tasks:**

- [x] Create an overview section.
- [x] Write installation instructions.
- [x] Provide usage examples.
- [x] Draft contributing guidelines.
- [ ] Compile FAQs.
- [x] Add license information.

title: Document Diablo's bugs
description:
Currently documented bugs: [The DSF Buglist for Diablo v1.09 (Lurker Lounge)](http://www.lurkerlounge.com/forums/thread-12422.html)

The goal of this issue is to document any *new* bugs we come across while examining the code that are ***native*** to the **original** game. This will help us fix them later on when we make mods/ports.
# New bugs discovered (last update 06/24/18)
- When casting a town portal in a quest level, leaving, and then going down into the dungon, the town portal will be placed in the dungeon. For example, `Chamber of Bone` is quest level 2, so the portal would appear on dungeon level 2 at the same X/Y coordinate.
- Diablo is supposed to be immune to the squelch radius, however, the game checks the AI for Diablo's monster type, thus always failing. `monster.cpp -> ProcessMonsters`
comments: Are these bugs going to be fixed in devilution after devilution development becomes stable or is the devilution source code gonna be a pure documentation update including leaving in the vanilla bugs?
The `Purpose` section of the readme has the answer.
Ah ok, I did read this like a week ago but I guess I forgot ;D.
The pull request above is basically a copy of the text from the original posting with some Markup for formatting. Is something like this is what is being requested?

We can definitely make use of your copy in case the original one goes down. However, this issue is to track new bugs that haven't been documented anywhere else, so that we can fix them in the future.

(Not Devilution of course, but mods based on)

As a rule for any bug published can we have the save file for this? I would like to have something to make this more easy to replicate...



because I am thinking on looking at the TP sequence and the Chamber of bone locations... because Technically TP is working but it's not marking the chamber of bone as a different map , if I am not mistaken...

EDIT:

I am probably completely wrong on that one. The dungeon map array  looks ok for the most part...

# **Eldritch Shrine Bug**
The Eldritch shrine (turns healing/mana pots into rejuvs and full pots into full rejuvs) uses the player's holding item buffer to temporarily store the rejuvs. What could possibly go wrong here?........ xD xD

If you click on the shrine and then pickup an item from your inventory/belt, the item you're holding will get overwritten. When you place it back down, it turns into a rejuv. BEWARE!

As a side note, this can be exploited for an extra rejuv, grabbing say 1 piece of gold or some junk item.

# Bugfix
The routine for this in `OperateShrine` should use a temporary buffer local to the function or the global temporary buffer `curruitem` to fix this. :)

> As a side note, this can be exploited for an extra rejuv, grabbing say 1 piece of gold or some junk item.

Haha, great hack!

Edit: actually the spaces in yellow are spots where there aren't any pixels in the .CEL, so the game never draws anything there. The function responsible for drawing the void fills them black. The only way to fix this is to edit the CEL map and create pixels in the empty spots.

Here is a list of seeds for Caves with that broken tile and the coordinate of it:

Here is code to fix the tile by brute force. It should be ran during `DRLG_L3`:
```
	for(j = 0; j < 40; j++)
	{
		for(i = 0; i < 40; i++)
		{
			if(dungeon[i][j] == 9 && dungeon[i - 1][j] == 13 && dungeon[i][j - 1] == 14)
			{
				dungeon[i][j] = 7; // set broken tiles to dirt instead of stalagmite
				dungeon[i][j - 1] = 7;
				dungeon[i-1][j] = 7;
			}
		}
	}
```

			if(dungeon[i][j] == 15 && dungeon[i][j + 1] == 1) { /// add this check

			}
```

The world is devised in to a diamond grid, a pice can be either solid or walkable. You can always walk to a neighboring tile, but players can only walk to diagonal tiles if they are not cornored off by solid tiles from both sides.

Only monsters can move between diagonally blocked tiles:
```

┌───┬───┐
│ X │   │
├───┼───┘
│   │ X │
└───┘───┘
```
Every one can move betwen any of the free tiles here:
```

┌───┬───┐
│   │   │
├───┼───┘
│   │ X │
└───┘───┘
```

> Every one can move betwen any of the free tiles here:

This does not reflect what I see with the tree:

```
  1   2   3
┌───┬───┐───┐
│   │   │   |  A
├───┼───┼───┼
│   │ X │ P |  B
├───┼───┼───┼
│   │ I │   |  C
└───┘───┘───┘
```

P = Character
X = Tree
I  = Item

**P** cannot move to diagonal squares. Furthermore, in order to pick up **I**, **P** has to move to C3. Is my grid correct?

I found another one with warrior - light armor's shield slightly changes color depending on if you are wearing a weapon or not, this change does not persist while moving

https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/pull/899/files
This explains the bug which causes unique monsters' light radius to appear on the level away from them.
From what I've seen, it works properly the first time you enter the level, but on next entries, the monsters might actually be generated in completely different places, where the light radius stays at the original spot

This is caused by two things in `LoadGameLevel` function
First one:
* calls to `GetRndSeed()` which actually change the seed itself
`glMid1Seed[currlevel] = GetRndSeed();` - glMid1Seed and friends are only used for debugging, yet affect the whole game


Second one is `HoldThemeRooms();`
This function changes the BFLAG_POPULATED flag for theme rooms, which prevents placing monsters and is only called when the level is entered for the first time.
And that's where things diverge - means `MonstPlace` will encounter different flags and return different values on subsequent entries  = different number of random calls = different random values = different monster positions

fixed by https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/pull/899

+ monsters have light index 0 by default, which is a perfectly valid index and code related to light treats -1 as having no light, also a vanilla bug
+ after you reenter level, light radius of all unique monsters gets moved to their spawn locations and only gets updated when they move
fixed by https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/pull/899

Written by [Bolty](https://www.lurkerlounge.com/forums/user-1.html) in 2010-08-08 at [The DSF Buglist for Diablo v1.09](http://www.lurkerlounge.com/forums/thread-12422.html). Copied here as a **mirror**:

Already part of https://github.com/diasurgical/scalpel/blob/master/BUGS.md
